Frequently Asked Questions

I found a currently available book from the bestseller list that I am interested in reading. How do I borrow it?

Click on the book cover. It’s a link that will bring you to the book’s OverDrive page where you will have the option of checking out the ebook from your library. You will need your library card number to complete the process. It may also be helpful to have OverDrive’s Libby app installed on your reading device ahead of time. Click here if you need help using Libby.

Is the Find a Bestseller tool only checking for books currently on the New York Times Bestseller list or is it also checking for books that were on older versions of the list?

The Find A Bestseller tool is checking current and past versions of the New York Times bestseller list.

Why is there a wait time for ebooks? Why can’t multiple people borrow the same book at once?

There are requirements for ebook lending made by book publishers that libraries have to follow. Often, one of these requirements is that each copy of an ebook that a library owns can only be borrowed by one person at a time.
